result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Larry R. Bryant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Larry R. Bryant in court.  Attorney Joseph Corcoran in court for Larry R. Bryant.  Attorney Jessica L. Krejcarek in court for State of Wisconsin. Clerk HM.  Judge signs order for final piece of discovery today.  Adjmt granted. FPT 12/8 930am. Bond continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared with Attorney Joseph Corcoran.     Clerk JT  Minutes:    ST called witness KPD Ofc Albert Gonzales; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Corcoran. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.   Bond continued.

ADDRESS INFO for Larry R. Bryant
Current: 4210 Maple Lane, #1A, Zion, IL 60099 United States  (Effective: 07-14-2022)
Prior: 2105 60th Street, Kenosha, WI 53143
Preliminary hearing on July 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

01:28 PM  
  Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Joseph Corcoran.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on 7/29/22 @ 900am.   Bond is continued.     jk

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on July 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:55 PM   Assistant District Attorney Sydney Star appeared for the State.   Defendant appeared in court in person.   Clerk JT  Minutes: Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm. Atty status. Bond continued with same conditions as previously set. State Public Defender has not been appointed counsel for DE. DE waives time for prelim hearing. rb
Status conference on May 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant, Larry R. Bryant, appeared.  Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: TAD or Tara D.  The DE may make arrangements with a party or law enforcement to retrieve personal property and/or medication from the both victim's residence within 24 hours of signing the bond in this case.  The DE may not be the party retrieving any property and/or medication.

02:11 PM  Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Toni Young.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on April 19, 2022 at 08:30 am. $2000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).  sg
